availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Patillow (Warren County, Kentucky, brickmason.)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, brickmason and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David J. Patillow and Mahala Patillow. Resident of Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Brick mason in Warren County in 1860. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Regiment Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private from August 14, 1862 to April 13, 1865. Captured near Bowling Green, Kentucky, on October 30, 1864. Prisoner of war at Camp Douglas, Illinois, from November 12, 1864, to April 13, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government at Camp Douglas on April 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
